properties.Initial_Detail_of_Accident: FDNY reported 50- 75 gallons of hydraulic fluid leaked over a 50 to 100yard radius. Coverinv street and sidewalks,. FDNY closed off West 45 Street between 5 & 6 Avenue.
properties.Cause_Equipment: FDNY reported 50- 75 gallons of hydraulic fluid leaked over a 50 to 100yard radius. Coverinv street and sidewalks,. FDNY closed off West 45 Street between 5 & 6 Avenue. Crane Inspector on site reported hose blew, no injuries reported. Report to follow.

properties.Initial_Detail_of_Accident: A Crane operator in the process of putting down outrigger, the out rigger went through the sidewalk and ruputured a gas line
properties.Cause_Equipment: A Crane operator in the process of putting down outrigger, the out rigger went through the sidewalk and ruputured a gas line

properties.Initial_Detail_of_Accident: PDNY reported crane is unstable due to high wind
properties.Detail_of_Description: Upon inspectoion crane was not in operation and was weathervaning as engineered. No action necessary.
properties.Cause_Equipment: Upon inspectoion crane was not in operation and was weathervaning as engineered. No action necessary.

properties.Initial_Detail_of_Accident: Cranes and Derricks was notified by SSM that power surge in electrical system of tower crane and it is unable to hoist or lower loads.  Structural stability not affected.
properties.Cause_Equipment: Lost electrical power due to a short circuit in the arch shielded coil within the control box.  The crane lost power to the hoist line drum at the 33rd floor level while hoisting a full 3 yard concrete bucket load to deck above 36th floor.  The boom was

properties.Initial_Detail_of_Accident: Site Safety Manager reported that the neighboring building at 875 Avenue of the Americas stated that the crane hit their building. The site safety manager does not see any damage.
properties.Detail_of_Description: C& D inspectors McGarrigle #2248 and Conti #1922 reported tower crane was setting column next to adjacent building.  They observed no unsafe operation, nor damage to building or boom. Complaint 1265923 will be closed as no action necessary.
properties.Cause_Equipment: C&D inspectors McGarrigle 2248 and Conti 1922 stated tower crane was setting column next to adjacent building observed no unsafe operation, and no damage to building or boom.  No action necessary at this time.

properties.Initial_Detail_of_Accident: Site safety manager reported a crane hit the sidewalk shed
properties.Cause_Equipment: Boom Crane housing lock malfunctioned causing the counter weights to swing and hit shed.

properties.Initial_Detail_of_Accident: The Site Safety Manager reported while a Crane was lowering the ball the cable snapped striking a city bus breaking the window.
properties.Cause_Equipment: Worker fail to hold sling line,allowing wind to swing it to the bus window, breaking the window, no injuries reported
